meanings.definition: A substance that inhibits oxidation, especially one used to counteract the deterioration of stored food products.
meanings.sent1: I added an antioxidant to the fruit to keep it fresh longer.
meanings.sent2: The antioxidant in the sauce helped preserve the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent3: The antioxidant swooped in like a superhero to save the food from spoiling.
meanings.sent4: Her presence was like an antioxidant, protecting the meal from decay.
meanings.sent5: The antioxidant acted as a shield, warding off the harmful effects of oxidation.

meanings.definition: A substance that prevents damage to cells caused by free radicals.
meanings.sent1: Eating foods rich in antioxidants can help protect your cells.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended increasing intake of antioxidant-rich foods.
meanings.sent3: The antioxidant danced through the body, fighting off free radicals with ease.
meanings.sent4: His words were like antioxidants, shielding her from the negativity around.
meanings.sent5: The antioxidant was like a guardian angel, defending the cells from harm.
